Posts.Content: May 11, 2012 10:07PM fiftycats wrote: Just went for bloodwork, and dr called and said my CA 27-29 results were 72.  Normally, all the other times I have been tested it has been 16-21 on average.  So,  what could make it go up this time?  What is this met everyone is talking about?  Is something I ate or did making the number rise?  I am going to have it done again next week,  but will it be changed?  I am worried
Posts.Title: CA 27-29 Tumor Marker test result brena bluepearl

Posts.Content: fiftycats wrote: Havent had my implants put in yet,  and I hope to get some questions answered here about it.   I had the drains in for a month+ when I had my mastoctomys.  I had 16 lymph nodes removed,  and the drain on that side would not stop draining.  I hear we have to have drains with the implants too.  I would like to hear how long everyone else had their drains in after implants were put in.  Not the expanders,  but after the expanders were removed and the implants were put in.  I am trying to figure out how long I will need to take off work.  I dont want my co workers to know what is going on.  I will take vacation days to have this done.  So I have to plan it so I can return to work on a certain day,  and not have to call in sick.  I know everyone is different,  but I need to hear everyones story.  I start radiation in a week,  so I have time to figure this out.  I wont see my surgeon for a while.  I just want to hear from others who have been there.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: implants, surgery questions fiftycats Susie123
